snippet: The Obama administration said 6.4 million people had signed up so far for 2017 health insurance, an increase of 400,000 over a similar point last year....
abstract: About 6.4 million people have registered for health insurance coverage in 2017 under Affordable Care Act, increase of 400,000 over previous year; jump is remarkable given Republican pledges to repeal law; coverage of millions could be imperiled after Pres-elect Donald Trump takes office.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said 6.4 million people had signed up so far for 2017 health insurance, an increase of 400,000 over a similar point last year.

headline.main: Health Exchange Enrollment Jumps, Even as G.O.P. Pledges Repeal
headline.print_headline: Sign-Ups Jump as Health Law Faces a Repeal

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
